author: Special Correspondent
text:
Leader of the Patel agitation in Gujarat, Hardik Patel, on Saturday broke his week-long fast by lunching with BJP MP Vithal Radadia, who is trying to broker peace between the Patel community and the Gujarat government over the quota issue.

On Saturday, Mr. Radadia held his second meeting with Hardik, lodged in Surat jail facing two sedition cases slapped by the Gujarat government after he launched a mass agitation demanding quota benefits for the Patel community in the State.

“He has started having food from today [Saturday]. We had lunch together from his tiffin in jail,” Mr. Radadia, a prominent leader of Patel community in Saurashtra, told the media in Surat.

“After my first meeting with Hardik, I met Gujarat Chief Minister Anandiben Patel to discuss the issues Hardik raised with me. I met him again and we have been able to resolve most of the issues and differences,” he added, indicating that a formal announcement of truce will be made in next few days.

Among the main issues, the 22-year-old leader raised include withdrawal of sedition cases slapped on him.
title: Hardik breaks fast, has lunch with Radadiya
